We recommend you send all log data to one Log Analytics workspace.\r\n \r\n 1. [Create a Log Analytics workspace](/azure/azure-monitor/logs/quick-create-workspace).\r\n-2. To incorporate the data you want to analyze, add diagnostics settings. See the following list.\r\n+2. To incorporate the data you want to analyze, add diagnostics settings. See the following list:\r\n \r\n * AuditLogs\r\n * SignInLogs\r\n@@ -125,7 +125,7 @@ Use the previous query to identify common user patterns, such as service account\n \r\n ## Discern risk event types\r\n \r\n-Risk even types include unfamiliar sign-in, unusual tokens, and unlikely travel are examples. After you determine user patterns, review detections and summarize them by the risk event type.  \r\n+After we've looked at patterns from specific users, we recommend reviewing the detections themselves and summarizing them by detection type.\r\n \r\n 1. Use the **AADUserRiskEvents** table.\r\n 2. Summarize with **RiskEventType**. \r\n@@ -261,5 +261,6 @@ To get started, explore the Azure Monitor log reference tables for Microsoft Ent\n \r\n \r\n \r\n+\r\n \r\n \r"
}. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary.","role":"user"}
ai_summary.Response:
This commit makes minor but important revisions to the documentation for analysing Microsoft Entra ID Protection.

Firstly, it corrects a minor grammatical point in step two of setting up diagnostics, changing "See the following list." to "See the following list:".

Secondly, it clarifies the wording in the "Discern risk event types" section. The previous phrasing was a little confusing, and the updated text now more accurately directs the reader to review detections and summarise them by detection type after identifying user patterns.
